description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -3000.

The game is a strategic coordination dilemma where option 1 is “safe” (yielding 0) and option 2 is “risky” – if played unilaterally it rewards the aggressor by the round input, but if both players choose it, the penalty multiplies the round input by 1000, leading to severe losses

Deepseek-R1 (Kate) has a default behavior of playing option 1, which normally would avoid significant losses; however, in the remembered round both players unexpectedly chose the aggressive option 2, indicating that even a model with a “safe” default can deviate, possibly testing strategies or attempting to exploit known defaults

The information provided (e.g., the round input of 3 leading to a –3000 payoff when both chose option 2) highlights how even a low round input can result in disastrously high negative payoffs when both players play aggressively, underscoring the critical importance of anticipating the other’s action in this multi-round game
